CONVERSATION GROUP: If you talk to him before the caravan attack happens
If you talk to him after the caravan attack happens

BK Morning! I hoped you'd come by to say hello. We so rarely get to mingle with the hardy folk hired to keep us safe on the road. Sad, because you're the only thing standing between us and certain peril!

Should play only the first time the player speaks with Burkins, and only if the ambush hasn't happened yet. Set a flag like "Burkins_TalkedTo" and check for it on the line above.
What a day! We're almost to Luskan, and we get attacked by bandits. My clients won't be happy about the delay. I can only hope I can find something to give them to make them more... understanding.
Say, I hear they attacked another caravan before ours. I bet they carried away some of those people's cargo. Spoils of battle, you might say.
Since you and I are friends now, maybe you would like to see what I have for sale? I'll give you a little discount. Below my usual "friends and family" rates.
I don't have time for chit-chat.
I hate to think of the others' valuable trade goods mouldering in the hands of such violent men. There must be something we can do!
If you want stolen cargo, you can get it yourself.
I think you have misunderstood each other. Never you mind, friend. I shouldn't have troubled you with this.
If you should happen to change your mind, you know where to find me.
I don't think so. I think I'll sell this stuff myself.
Well then, I wish you luck. I had better get back to work. With any luck this will all be behind us soon.

BK trimmed this... without VO I'm not sure the "I know" will make sense.
I know. So many people think it's a name someone made up on a whim. But actually, it's an old family name.
I got tired of people massacring the name "Oraphelia." And well, to be honest, "Burkins" isn't any worse than that.
Me? Of course not. And if I were, I think I'd trust my caravan's hired mercenaries to remain discreet about it.
Nothing, for now. My wares are all packed up at the moment. I don't want random people from the caravan fooling about with my valuable items, do I?
Maybe once we get to town, or if we have to spend more time here in camp, I'll open things up for sale. But for now, I just want to get moving and get to town.
Good to see you again! I can see you're working hard to keep us safe from brigands and ne'er-do-wells.
